fields.headline: Small press corner
fields.bodyText: Bloody Sunday: Lord Widgery's Report,1972 (The Stationery Office, £6.99) The latest in Tim Coates's invaluable series of books shaped from Stationery Office records is an object lesson in official flummery. On 17-year-old Kevin McElhinney, shot in the buttock while crawling to cover, Widgery reports: ". . . it seems probable that the firer was Sergeant K. This senior NCO was a qualified marksman whose rifle was fitted with a telescopic sight and who fired only one round in the course of the afternoon . . . Sergeant K obviously acted with responsibility and restraint." So that's all right then.
